page.title: 04IRON AGE FORT S. OF BARRHEAD
page.content:
{DUNCARNOCK}(known locally as the Craigie) lies 1 mile south of{Barrhead adjacent to Glanderston Dam, and is the site of an{IRON AGE HILL FORT.
The fort occupies the top of a steep-sided crag, towering over the surrounding landscape.
Other forts in the area are larger but the ramparts of{Duncarnock}are the best preserved and can be traced round most of the hill-top as a grass-grown bank. On the east side the ramparts still survive as a dry-stone wall.
The date of the fort is not certain but it was probably built in the{Early {Iron Age}......perhaps about 400 B.C.
